summaryText: What a powerful and timely message from Pastor Chris Durso about overcoming fear and understanding our true spiritual position! Pastor Chris dives deep into the story of Lazarus, revealing an incredible truth: the enemy might plot against us, but God's plans are always superior. He brilliantly unpacks how many of us are living paralyzed by empty threats - words and fears that have no real power over us. The most profound moment? When he explains that the very reason the enemy targets us is because our very existence threatens his kingdom! Our progress, our miracles, our testimonies are walking billboards that prove God's transformative power. Pastor Chris reminds us that we're not just survivors, we're VICTORIOUS - protected by the Lion of Judah Himself. The enemy may form weapons, but they will NOT prosper! This sermon is a battle cry for believers who've been stuck, scared, and silent - it's time to rise up and recognize who we are in Christ!
mainPoints: The enemy's threats are powerless against God's destiny
Your miracle and progress threaten the enemy's kingdom
Stay in God's presence and refuse to be moved by fear

versesMentioned.text: Meanwhile a large crowd of Jews found out that Jesus was there and came, not only because of him but also to see Lazarus, whom he had raised from the dead. So the chief priests made plans to kill Lazarus as well, for on account of him many of the Jews were going over to Jesus and believing in him.
For the Lord your God is the one who goes with you to fight for you against your enemies to give you victory.

Be alert and of sober mind. Your enemy the devil prowls around like a roaring lion looking for someone to devour. Resist him, standing firm in the faith, because you know that the family of believers throughout the world is undergoing the same kind of sufferings.

No weapon forged against you will prevail, and you will refute every tongue that accuses you. This is the heritage of the servants of the Lord, and this is their vindication from me, declares the Lord.

for he is our God and we are the people of his pasture, the flock under his care. Today, if you hear his voice, do not harden your hearts as you did at Meribah, as you did that day at Massah in the wilderness.

Monday.scripture: Psalm 46:1: 'God is our refuge and strength, an ever-present help in trouble.'
Monday.focus: Recognizing God as our ultimate protection
Monday.action: List three current fears or challenges. Beside each, write how God might be protecting or working in that situation, even if you can't see it.
Monday.prayer: Lord, help me see beyond my fears and recognize Your protective hand in my life. Give me spiritual eyes to see Your work, even when circumstances seem challenging. Amen.

Tuesday.scripture: 2 Timothy 1:7: 'For God has not given us a spirit of fear, but of power and of love and of a sound mind.'
Tuesday.action: Identify one area where fear has been controlling your decisions. Consciously make a choice today that demonstrates faith instead of fear.
Tuesday.prayer: God, replace my spirit of fear with Your spirit of power. Help me walk in courage and trust, knowing You are always with me. Amen.

Wednesday.scripture: Romans 8:31: 'What, then, shall we say in response to these things? If God is for us, who can be against us?'
Wednesday.action: Write a personal declaration of faith. Include who you are in Christ and the promises you believe about your identity.
Wednesday.prayer: Father, remind me of my true identity in You. Help me walk in the confidence of Your love and protection. Strengthen my faith today. Amen.

Thursday.scripture: Joshua 1:9: 'Have I not commanded you? Be strong and courageous. Do not be afraid; do not be discouraged, for the Lord your God will be with you wherever you go.'
Thursday.action: Do something that slightly scares you - something that requires stepping out in faith. This could be a conversation, a task, or a personal challenge.
Thursday.prayer: Lord, give me courage to step out of my comfort zone. Help me trust You in moments of uncertainty. Guide my steps today. Amen.

Friday.scripture: Philippians 4:13: 'I can do all this through him who gives me strength.'
Friday.focus: Recognizing our strength comes from God
Friday.action: Reflect on a past victory where God helped you overcome. Journal about how that experience can inspire your current challenges.
Friday.prayer: God, thank You for Your constant strength. Remind me of Your faithfulness in past seasons and give me hope for the present. Amen.

Saturday.scripture: Psalm 34:4: 'I sought the Lord, and he answered me; he delivered me from all my fears.'
Saturday.action: Spend extended time in prayer, specifically naming and releasing your fears to God. Listen for His voice and guidance.
Saturday.prayer: Heavenly Father, I surrender my fears to You. Fill me with Your peace that surpasses understanding. Help me trust You completely. Amen.
